snippet.title: HERE COMES THE RBA INTEREST RATE DECISION...
snippet.content:
The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) is about to release its August interest rate decision.
While no one expects that rates will change today, there'll still be plenty of interest in the accompanying monetary policy statement, especially with the RBA set to release updated forecasts for Australian economic growth, inflation and unemployment later in the week.
And then there's the Australian dollar, with markets seemingly split on whether the bank will express renewed concern over its recent strength.
For the past year the bank has been warning that stronger Aussie would "complicate" Australia's economic transition away from the mining investment boom.
This is likely to be a major talking point following the release of today's statement.
For those looking for further information on what to expect, this
The August statement will be released at 2.30pm AEST.
This page will be updated with all the details and talking points once it hits the screens.
